introduction: This practice helps you manage anxiety through sensory awareness.
challenge: Ground yourself with the 5-4-3-2-1 senses exercise whenever you feel overwhelmed.
starting_question: When anxiety hits, what are five things you can see right now?
ai_prompt: Guide the user calmly through the 5-4-3-2-1 grounding exercise, pausing after each sense and checking in on their feelings at the end.

introduction: Pausing buys a moment to choose a safer response when anger rises.
challenge: Use the S-T-O-P skill to pause before acting when anger or impulse spikes.
starting_question: What usually happens right before you act on anger?
ai_prompt: Coach the user through each letter of the S-T-O-P skill, offer concrete examples, and give space for their reflections.

introduction: Rapid body-based techniques to lower extreme emotional arousal.
challenge: Cool down fast with one TIPP technique (cold water, quick exercise, paced breathing, or muscle-tensing).
reward: Ability to self-soothe quickly during crises.
starting_question: How does your body feel when emotions are out of control?
ai_prompt: Present the four TIPP options, help the user pick one feasible right now, then guide them through it safely and check the results.

introduction: Release tension by tensing and relaxing muscle groups in sequence.
challenge: Practice a quick paired-muscle relaxation session to reduce physical tension and stress.
reward: Looser muscles and a calmer mind.
starting_question: Which part of your body feels the tightest right now?
ai_prompt: Guide the user to briefly tense and then relax each major muscle group, remind them to breathe, and check in on how their body feels afterward.

introduction: Noticing sensations from head to toe anchors you in the present moment.
challenge: Do a two-minute body scan, slowly placing attention on each body part without judgment.
reward: Greater mindfulness and connection with your body.
starting_question: Can you notice how your toes feel right now without moving them?
ai_prompt: Lead the user through a slow attention sweep from feet to head, prompting gentle observation at each region and pausing to breathe.

introduction: Shaking out muscles helps discharge built-up stress energy quickly.
challenge: Try a one-minute full-body shake or stretch to lower stress and loosen tension.
reward: Fast stress relief and refreshed energy.
starting_question: Where in your body do you feel pent-up energy right now?
ai_prompt: Instruct the user (if safe) to stand, shake arms, shoulders, and legs for about 60 seconds while breathing steadily; afterwards guide them to notice any changes.

introduction: Being prepared helps you feel safer when strong distress hits.
challenge: Create a brief safety coping plan listing warning signs, three coping skills, and trusted contacts you can reach out to.
reward: Feeling prepared and supported during future crises.
starting_question: What are the first signs that tell you you're heading into a crisis?
ai_prompt: Guide the user to identify their warning signs, pick three coping skills they trust, list people or services they can reach, and summarize the plan for easy reference.

introduction: Spot the link between thoughts, feelings, and actions.
challenge: Complete a simple CBT thought record about a recent upsetting event and write one kinder alternative thought.
starting_question: Which upsetting event from today keeps replaying in your mind?
ai_prompt: Walk the user through situation, thought, feeling (with intensity), behavior, and co-create one balanced alternative thought.

introduction: Break down big challenges into doable actions.
challenge: Work through the six-step problem-solving process on a real-life challenge.
reward: Practical steps toward goals and reduced overwhelm.
starting_question: What problem is stressing you out most this week?
ai_prompt: Lead the user through all six problem-solving steps, ensure open brainstorming, and help them choose a small first actionable step.

introduction: Explore mixed feelings about change without pressure.
challenge: Fill out a decisional-balance grid to explore the pros and cons of a change you’re unsure about.
starting_question: What change are you currently on the fence about?
ai_prompt: Create a four-quadrant decisional balance, explore each side with the user, summarize, and ask what stands out to them.

challenge: Identify and name one personal strength or coping strategy you’ve used recently.
starting_question: Think of a tough moment you got through—how did you manage it?
ai_prompt: Help the user spot and name a specific strength or coping strategy and provide a genuine affirmation.

introduction: Learn why your body reacts under stress.
challenge: Learn the science behind the fight-or-flight response through a brief psycho-education chat.
starting_question: Have you noticed physical changes when you feel stressed?
ai_prompt: Explain the fight-or-flight response in clear, youth-friendly language, use relatable examples, and verify understanding.

introduction: Save helpful techniques for quick use.
challenge: Add one coping skill you like to your personal “My Coping Skills” list inside the chatbot.
starting_question: Which coping skill has helped you feel calmer before?
ai_prompt: Add the chosen coping skill to the user’s personal list, confirm it’s saved, and show how to access it later.

introduction: Track how skills shift your state.
challenge: After any grounding or relaxation exercise, message the AI describing how your body and mood changed.
reward: Better awareness of what works for you.
starting_question: After practicing, what changes do you notice in your body or mood?
ai_prompt: Invite a post-exercise reflection, mirror the user’s observations, and encourage continued practice.

introduction: Transform a big dream into an actionable start.
challenge: Break a big goal (like finishing school) into the very first tiny step you’ll try this week.
starting_question: What big life goal keeps popping into your head?
ai_prompt: Help the user break the big goal into the smallest next step, set a realistic timeframe, and plan a follow-up.

challenge: Practice the paced-breathing animation for one minute every day to build a calmness habit.
starting_question: Can you set aside one minute right now to practice calm breathing?
ai_prompt: Run a 60-second paced-breathing animation, encourage daily repetition, and track streaks if the user agrees.

challenge: Whenever you catch harsh self-talk, work with the AI to rephrase it in a kinder, strength-based way.
reward: Kinder inner voice and improved mood.
starting_question: What harsh thought about yourself did you notice most recently?
ai_prompt: Ask the user to share the harsh thought, model reframing into a kinder statement, and check how the new wording feels.
